weka.core.converters
Class CassandraLoader

java.lang.Object
  weka.core.converters.AbstractLoader
      weka.core.converters.CassandraLoader
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, CommandlineRunnable, BatchConverter, IncrementalConverter, Loader, NoSQLConverter, NoSQLLoader, EnvironmentHandler, OptionHandler, RevisionHandler
public class CassandraLoader
extends AbstractLoader
implements BatchConverter, IncrementalConverter, NoSQLLoader, OptionHandler, EnvironmentHandler, CommandlineRunnable

Although a JDBC driver exists for Cassandra, this custom loader was written to access Cassandra via the low-level Thrift API. The reason for this is that certain useful functions can be accessed at the Thrift level and aren't available via the JDBC driver. The most important of these is the ability to access table meta data, including type information for columns (where defined), without having to execute a query to the database.

Version:
$Revision: 48815 $
Author:
Mark Hall (mhall{[at]}pentaho{[dot]}com)
See Also:

public java.lang.String textToNominalValuesTipText()

setTextToNominalValues

public void setTextToNominalValues(java.lang.String nominalSpecs)
Set any legal nominal values to use for incoming text fields that do not already have legal values stored in the column family meta data. If not specified then text fields become String attributes when converted.

The format is:

attName1:{val1, val2,...};attName2:{val1, val2,...};...

Parameters:
nominalSpecs - a semi-colon list of attribute names followed by legal values.

getTextToNominalValues

public java.lang.String getTextToNominalValues()
Get any legal nominal values to use for incoming text fields that do not already have legal values stored in the column family meta data. If not specified then text fields become String attributes when converted.

The format is:

attName1:{val1, val2,...};attName2:{val1, val2,...};...

Returns:
a semi-colon list of attribute names followed by legal values.

setOutputKey

public void setOutputKey(boolean k)
Set whether to output the key of the column family as an attribute or not. The name of the attribute for the key is the same as the name of the column family.

Parameters:
k - true if the key is to be output as an attribute.

getOutputKey

public boolean getOutputKey()
Get whether to output the key of the column family as an attribute or not. The name of the attribute for the key is the same as the name of the column family.

Returns:
true if the key is to be output as an attribute.

outputKeyTipText

public java.lang.String outputKeyTipText()

Returns:
the tip text

setOutputSparseInstances

public void setOutputSparseInstances(boolean o)
Set whether to output sparse instances or not. In non-sparse mode, missing columns in incoming cassandra rows get converted to missing values in each dense instance. In sparse mode, missing columns are zeros. Sparse mode does not support missing values for non-sparse values.

Parameters:
o - true if sparse instances are to be output.

getOutputSparseInstances

public boolean getOutputSparseInstances()
Get whether to output sparse instances or not. In non-sparse mode, missing columns in incoming cassandra rows get converted to missing values in each dense instance. In sparse mode, missing columns are zeros. Sparse mode does not support missing values for non-sparse values.

Returns:
true if sparse instances are to be output.

getDataSet

public Instances getDataSet()
                     throws java.io.IOException
Return the full data set. If the structure hasn't yet been determined by a call to getStructure then method should do so before processing the rest of the data set.

Specified by:
getDataSet in interface Loader
Specified by:
getDataSet in class AbstractLoader
Returns:
the structure of the data set as an empty set of Instances
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if there is no source or parsing fails

getNextInstance

public Instance getNextInstance(Instances structure)
                         throws java.io.IOException
Read the data set incrementally---get the next instance in the data set or returns null if there are no more instances to get. If the structure hasn't yet been determined by a call to getStructure then method should do so before returning the next instance in the data set.

Specified by:
getNextInstance in interface Loader
Specified by:
getNextInstance in class AbstractLoader
Parameters:
structure - the dataset header information, will get updated in case of string or relational attributes
Returns:
the next instance in the data set as an Instance object or null if there are no more instances to be read
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if an error occurs
